channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: House passes anti-terrorism bill
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: The House of Representatives has passed the proposed measure that seeks to impose harsher punishment on terrorist acts.

item.title: Go sponsors two more health bills for government hospitals
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Sen. Bong Go is pushing two more local hospital bills to further improve the delivery of medical and healthcare services, especially in the provinces, amid the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Cyclists want protection, space in ‘better normal’
item.author: Marc Jayson Cayabyab
item.description: A cyclists’ group set up bicycle lanes along a busy highway in Quezon City yesterday, hoping to prove to transport officials that bikers deserve a space – even one bounded by cones – during the new normal.

item.title: Most displaced OFWs would rather not return home – DOLE
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: Over 300,000 overseas Filipino workers have been affected by the coronavirus disease or COVID-19 pandemic, but the Department of Labor and Employment yesterday said most of them would rather stay abroad than return home.

item.title: Doctors, ARK to work together to save lives, livelihood
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: The Philippine Medical Association, which is now recommending the use of rapid test kits after criticizing them, is set to collaborate with Presidential Adviser on Entrepreneurship and Go Negosyo founder Joey Concepcion’s Project Antibody Rapid test Kit initiative to help save both lives and livelihood.

item.title: Lapid seeks probe on Philippines internet connectivity
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Sen. Lito Lapid is seeking an inquiry on the status of the country’s internet connectivity and relevant parameters as many offices rely on work-from-home arrangements to limit the movement of employees amid the easing of quarantine protocols starting this week.

item.title: Virus transmission rate slows – DOH
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: Owing to the implementation of enhanced community quarantine (ECQ) in the past months, the transmission rate of coronavirus disease 2019 or COVID-19 has decreased, according to the Department of Health.

item.title: Buildings with 2 or more COVID cases face lockdown
item.author: Jose Rodel Clapano
item.description: Buildings that have at least two occupants with coronavirus disease 2019 will be placed under lockdown.

item.title: Traditional jeepney phaseout to proceed
item.author: Richmond Mercurio
item.description: With still no clear timeline as to when they can resume operations amid the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic, the Philippines’ traditional jeepneys, dubbed “king of the road,” may no longer be plying major thoroughfares in Metro Manila.

item.title: Over 350,000 households failed to get cash aid
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: More than 350,000 target beneficiaries of the government’s social amelioration program for sectors affected by quarantine restrictions have not yet received the emergency cash susbidy, a report submitted on Monday by President Duterte to Congress showed.
